title: Student Activities
content: Students in the D3 Railway Transportation Management program participate in various activities that support academic and professional development. These activities include railway operation simulations, visits to train depots, stations, and railway control centers, as well as training in railway management software. They also take part in seminars, workshops, and competitions addressing railway transportation innovation and efficiency. Students engage in community service activities, such as educating the public on railway safety. Through these activities, students not only enhance their technical skills but also build extensive professional networks.
